description.llm: This component will be used to display pricing information for different SaaS product tiers. It should include product tier names, their prices, features, as well as a button to select that particular tier. This component could be used in a pricing section of a website, where users can compare different SaaS product tiers and choose the best one based on their needs. It should also be interactive so that when a pricing tier is selected, it changes its style to show it is selected.

components.name: Card
components.usage: To display each product tier in a separate, but uniform style.

components.name: Button
components.usage: To allow users to select a pricing tier.

data.content:
Library components can be used while making the new React component

Suggested library component (1/2) : Button - Displays a button or a component that looks like a button.
Suggested usage : To display each product tier in a separate, but uniform style.


# Button can be imported into the new component like this:
```tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"
```

---

# examples of how Button can be used inside the new component:
```tsx
<Button variant="outline">Button</Button>
```

```tsx
import { buttonVariants } from "@/components/ui/button"
<Link className={buttonVariants({ variant: "outline" })}>Click here</Link>
```

---

# full code examples of React components that use Button :
```button-with-icon.tsx
import { Mail } from "lucide-react"

import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonWithIcon() {
  return (
    <Button>
      <Mail className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" /> Login with Email
    </Button>
  )
}
```

```button-destructive.tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonDestructive() {
  return <Button variant="destructive">Destructive</Button>
}
```

```button-demo.tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonDemo() {
  return <Button>Button</Button>
}
```

```button-outline.tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonOutline() {
  return <Button variant="outline">Outline</Button>
}
```

```button-ghost.tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonGhost() {
  return <Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
}
```

```button-secondary.tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonSecondary() {
  return <Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
}
```

```button-icon.tsx
import { ChevronRight } from "lucide-react"

import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonIcon() {
  return (
    <Button variant="outline" size="icon">
      <ChevronRight className="h-4 w-4" />
    </Button>
  )
}
```

```button-loading.tsx
import { Loader2 } from "lucide-react"

import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonLoading() {
  return (
    <Button disabled>
      <Loader2 className="mr-2 h-4 w-4 animate-spin" />
      Please wait
    </Button>
  )
}
```

```button-link.tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export default function ButtonLink() {
  return <Button variant="link">Link</Button>
}
```

Library components can be used while making the new React component Suggested library component (2/2) : Card - Displays a card with header, content, and footer. Suggested usage : To allow users to select a pricing tier. # Card can be imported into the new component like this: ```tsx import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardFooter, CardHeader, CardTitle, } from "@/components/ui/card" ``` --- # examples of how Card can be used inside the new component: ```tsx Card Title Card Description

Card Content

Card Footer

 ``` ---

Icon elements can optionally be used when making the React component.

---

# example: importing icons in the component (only import the ones you need) :

```tsx
import { MoveDown , ArrowDownRight , ArrowDownToLine , ArrowDownSquare , ArrowDownAZ , MoveDownRight , ArrowDownFromLine , ArrowDownLeft , ArrowDown10 , CheckCheck , SearchCheck , BadgeCheck , PackageCheck , MailCheck , BookmarkCheck , CalendarCheck2 , UserCheck2 , CalendarCheck } from "lucide-react";
```

# example: using an icon inside the component :

```tsx
<MoveDown className="h-4 w-4" />
```

---


Here are some available icons that might be relevant to the component you are making. You can choose from them if relevant :

```
- MoveDown , ArrowDownRight , ArrowDownToLine , ArrowDownSquare , ArrowDownAZ , MoveDownRight , ArrowDownFromLine , ArrowDownLeft , ArrowDown10
- CheckCheck , SearchCheck , BadgeCheck , PackageCheck , MailCheck , BookmarkCheck , CalendarCheck2 , UserCheck2 , CalendarCheck
```
